Posts.Content: WorkingMom10 wrote: Hi, everyone!  A few weeks ago, I learned that I have DCIS, stage 0, in my right breast.  The news was such a shock to me.  I am 43 years old, married for almost 19 years to the most wonderful husband ever, and proud mom to a 10 year old son.  My BS ordered a bilateral breast MRI for me on 24 May and will call me after that to discuss a date for a lumpectomy.  She seemed to think that I would need radiation, but did not want to confirm it at this point.  She said I would likely need it because of my age and the size of the DCIS (1.5 cm).  I live 150 miles away from  my doctors/hospital, so this throws a lot of scheduling problems with my job for  the next few months.  However, I know my health has to come first and I want to do everything that I can to take care of myself now, so I will probably opt to do the radiation.  Any advice you can give me on getting additional care (should I also be seeing an oncologist in addition to the BS) or on what to expect during surgery would be so much appreciated!  The waiting is making me crazy!  Thank you all so much!  Christine Dx 4/26/2011, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+ Surgery 7/17/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Dx 11/1/2016, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/22/2016 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 12/5/2016 External: Bone Hormonal Therapy 5/4/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 3/14/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Bilateral vs. Unilateral Mastectomy WorkingMom10 habbott

Posts.Content: WorkingMom10 wrote: I am 1 year from my initial MBC diagnosis after bone (spine, left rib, and both hips) and lymph node activity. I just had my 3 month scans this month. My CT scan showed NED, but my bone scan showed a new area of activity in one of my ribs on the right side that was not there before. I freaked out about it, but my onc told me that it was nothing to worry about because it did not show on the CT scan. They had me do a rib xray in case the activity came from an injury of some kind, but that xray came back negative. I am not having any significant pain around that area either. I'm concerned that something should be done, but I wanted to ask if anyone else has had bone scans show something like this and your onc said it was nothing to worry about. All the other areas of my bone scan where my previous cancer was all showed stable. I am currently on tamoxifen and completed 6 months of weekly chemo in April 2017 (taxol). Thanks in advance! Dx 4/26/2011, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+ Surgery 7/18/2011 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): DIEP flap; Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Dx 11/1/2016, Stage IV, metastasized to bone, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/23/2016 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 12/5/2016 External: Bone Hormonal Therapy 5/5/2017 Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Targeted Therapy 3/15/2018 Verzenio Log in to post a reply
